ygData.subject: RE: revenge is sweet you know...
ygData.msgSnippet: On a similar subject, I was confused about the message concerning disenchanting melody...someone said it dispels one affect per pulse, starting apparently with
ygData.messageBody:
On a similar subject, I was confused about the message concerning
disenchanting melody...someone said it dispels one affect per pulse,
starting apparently with the most recently applied one...does this also
include beneficial affects such as Bravery, Strength, SoW, etc...or just
harmful ones like Blood Boil and walking sleep, and more importantly,
ghoulroot?

-Faras Tar'Linedhel
E'ci

> -----Original Message-----
> From: CYR, Thierry [mailto:tcyr@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, September 14, 1999 3:49 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] revenge is sweet you know...
>
>
> From: "CYR, Thierry" <tcyr@...>
>
> any alchemy shop supposedly has them, and it does infact
> dispell sow, we've
> unbuffed ourselves a few times by accident.
>
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4
> [SMTP:g4mntofcr@...]
> > Sent: September 14, 1999 4:35 PM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] revenge is sweet you know...
> >
> > From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> >
> > I have heard about the Pumice stone dispelling buffs but I
> have never used
> > it myself or witnessed anyone ever using it before. Where can you
> > find/buy
> > them at? Also, do they dispel both positive and negative
> buffs or only
> > negative buffs? If they only dispel negative buffs, I
> wouldn't think they
> > would cancel SOW since the game classifies that as a
> positive buff. Can
> > you
> > provide more info on how pumice works?
> >
> > I love this list. Learn something new every day:-)
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
>
